content.description: Start on the left end of the long low rail in the best holds available. Make a move or two up to the rounded and sloping top. Press out the mantle.
content.location: This problem is in the trees back around and right of the main face in the area.

content.description: Start matched on wide crimp on short overhang. Move up and left with a few powerful moves and exit straight up. Short problem but worth the effort while in the area.
content.location: When looking at Jumpin Otik turn left and scramble up to next level on same boulder. Furthers left line.

content.description: Start with your left hand on a good left-facing flake and jump to a high right-handed crimp. Continue left and mantle.
Crimpy and technical. So Why did Chris do it? See topo

This good warm up can be quite frigid being hidden between all the boulders. The right wall of the corner and many of the hand holds are quite polished while the left wall offers some good texture to smear on. 

  Start on a high hold and paste your feet to move up into the corner. Follow edges up towards the light.
content.location: This problem is to the right through the tunnel from the main face where Jumpin' Otik is located. It is on the boulder that would be at your back as you enter the alcove facing Jumpin' Otik.

content.description: For the stand start to this problem grab a high two handed edge. Pull up to holds just above the overhang and figure out how to get to the top of the blank vertical section. OH and don't dab on the boulder to your left.
content.location: Looking at the Otik boulder, turn right and you will see an alcove. This problem climbs the arete on the right side of the entrance to that alcove.

content.description: A rare treat. Hard climbing on solid stone with real holds. See topo

Pretty intimidating line at the grade. The climbing is more like what you would expect on desert sandstone. 

  Start from a high rail that is out over a lower landing. Push up to the flake and bump up to what ever spot floats your boat. Hike your foot up onto the starting ledge and try to get your weight over it so you can stand up.
content.location: This problem starts up and left of the main Otik face. Start off of the boulder at the left end of the face and reach up and out right to gain the good ledge.

content.description: Nice shady area with about 18 problems.
